title: Start of Lent in the Northeast
text:
Start of Lent in the Northeast 2 Jul 2015 at 03:29 173 viewed 0   LIFE | WRITER: PICHAYA SVASTI - + From July 30 to July 31, the Candle Light Procession Ceremony will take place around Phra That Phanom, a major stupa, at Wat Phra That Phanom in That Phanom district, Nakhon Phanom province, to commemorate two important Buddhist days â€” Asarnha Bucha Day and Buddhist Lent Day. There will be a candle light procession to pay homage to Phra That Phanom as well as an alms offering ceremony. Enshrined within Phra That Phanom are eight fragments of the Lord Buddha's chest bone. According to legend, the Lord Buddha spent a night where Wat Phra That Phanom is located. This stupa is considered a sacred site for those born in the Year of Monkey and also those born on a Sunday. 
Phra That Phanom. 
Visitors can also join the ongoing photo contest under the concept of "Buddhist Way of Life at Phra That Phanom" by submitting their pictures to the TAT local office. Entries will be accepted until Aug 15. Call the TAT Call Centre 1672 or the TAT Nakhon Phanom Office on 042-513-490/1. Fruity Prachuap Khiri Khan 
Until July 6, the "Farm Produce of the Town of Three Bays" Fair will be held at the Chalerm Phra Kiat Park in front of the provincial hall of Prachuap Khiri Khan. 
This province has plenty of farmland and farmers who grow pineapple, coconut, cassava, oil palm, sugar cane and mango trees. 
Activities include exhibitions on agricultural development and innovation, vegetable gardening contests, cooking contests and the sale of farm produce and Otop goods. Call the Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT) Call Centre 1672. Durian Fest in Hua Hin 
From July 10 to July 19, the Pa La Ou Durian Festival will take place in front of Market Village in Hua Hin, Prachuap Khiri Khan. Visitors can buy organic durian from the vicinity of the Pa La Ou Waterfall in this district as well as mangosteen, rambutan and several other fruits grown by local farmers. Durian here is aromatic, sweet and crunchy. Call Market Village on 032-618-888. Amazing Thailand Grand Sale 
Until Aug 15, tourists and shoppers can enjoy the best deals for different goods and services at numerous shopping malls, airlines, hotels, tour companies, duty-free shops, luxurious shops, golf courses and spas in Thailand under the annual Amazing Thailand Grand Sale campaign. 
This campaign mainly attracts target tourists from Malaysia, Singapore, Hong Kong, Vietnam, Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, Russia and the United Arab Emirates to travel and buy products from Thailand during this off-peak tourist season. Call the TAT Call Centre 1672. Mega Sale in Malaysia 
Until Aug 31, the Malaysia Mega Sale Carnival 2015 will take place all over Malaysia for all to enjoy shopping, eating and relaxing in style. 
Of more than 1,000 participating shopping malls and brands, five leading shopping malls are recommended for shoppers. Pavillion Kuala Lumpur, which is decorated in the luxury New York style, has over 500 stores, food courts and monthly events. Suria KLCC, housed in the famous Petronas Twin Towers, offers special discounts for several leading brands. 1Utama, the world's fourth biggest shopping mall in the atmosphere of tropical forests, features more than 700 shops and the city's largest food court. Mid Valley Megamall is the world's eighth largest shopping mall featuring at least three malls, such as Isetan, Carrefour and Robinson and many high-end and street brands. Sunway Pyramid, the world's 10th biggest shopping mall, is decorated in the Egyptian style and focuses on Asian goods. It houses a premium amusement park. Visit www.tourism.gov.my/en/intl for more information. if you have any news to share.   0 people liked / 0
